article.headline: Detroit 66, Ill.-Chicago 54
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Brandon Cotton scored 22 points while leading Detroit to a 66-54 win over Illinois-Chicago on Saturday. After trailing Detroit 28-22 at halftime, the Flames went on a 17-7 run to take a two-point lead on Jermaine Dailey's dunk with 11:21 left in the game. But the Titans quickly answered with 13 unanswered points of their own to take control of the game for good. The Titans (6-12, 3-4 Horizon) outrebounded UIC 40-25, and outscored the Flames at the foul line 16-4. Brandon Bell joined Cotton in double figures for Detroit with 11 points. Ryvon Covile added nine points and a game-high 12 rebounds for the Titans. Othyus Jeffers and Josh Mayo led UIC (9-11, 4-3 Horizon) with 15 points apiece.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
